title: Creating a reading list for event-centric natural language processing (NLP) involves selecting articles that cover a range of topics, including natural language understanding (NLU), event extraction, commonsense understanding, and other relevant aspects. Here is a list of 20 articles up to 2021 that should provide a comprehensive overview
**"Event Extraction from Newswire Articles: A Case Study"** by Ralph Grishman
This paper discusses early approaches to event extraction from news articles
**"A Survey on Event Extraction Methods from Text"** by Thien Huu Nguyen and Ralph Grishman
A comprehensive survey of event extraction techniques
**"Deep Learning for Event-Driven Stock Prediction"** by Ding, Xiao, et al
Explores the use of deep learning for event extraction in financial contexts
**"Event Detection and Domain Adaptation with Convolutional Neural Networks"** by Nguyen
Discusses the use of CNNs for event detection and domain adaptation
**"Joint Event Extraction via Recurrent Neural Networks"** by Feng, Yubo, et al
Introduces a joint model for event extraction using RNNs
**"Event Detection and Co-reference with Minimal Supervision"** by Chen, Yubo, et al
Focuses on event detection with minimal supervision
**"A Survey on Recent Advances in Event Detection from Text"** by Chen, Yubo, et al
Reviews recent advances in event detection methodologies
**"Event2Mind: Commonsense Inference on Events, Intents, and Reactions"** by Rashkin, Hannah, et al
Introduces a dataset and model for commonsense inference on events
**"BERT for Event Extraction and Co-reference Resolution"** by Wadden, David, et al
Explores the use of BERT for event extraction and co-reference resolution
**"Jointly Extracting Event Triggers and Arguments by Dependency-Bridge RNN and Tensor-Based Argument Interaction"** by Sha, Li, et al
Proposes a model for joint extraction of event triggers and arguments
**"Open Information Extraction: The Second Generation"** by Mausam, et al
Discusses open information extraction, which is relevant for event extraction
**"Event Extraction as Machine Reading Comprehension"** by Du, Xinya, et al
Frames event extraction as a reading comprehension task
**"A Survey on Commonsense Knowledge Acquisition: From Crowdsourcing to Automatic Extraction"** by Ilievski, Filip, et al
Surveys methods for acquiring commonsense knowledge, relevant for understanding events
**"Event Extraction as Multi-turn Question Answering"** by Liu, Jian, et al
Proposes a multi-turn QA approach to event extraction
**"Event Argument Extraction by Pointer Networks"** by Yang, Heng, et al
Introduces pointer networks for extracting event arguments
**"A Survey on Deep Learning for Named Entity Recognition"** by Li, Jinchao, et al
While focused on NER, this survey is relevant for understanding entities in event extraction
**"CommonsenseQA: A Question Answering Challenge Targeting Commonsense Knowledge"** by Talmor, Alon, et al
Discusses a QA challenge that involves commonsense reasoning
**"Event Extraction via Dynamic Multi-Pooling Convolutional Neural Networks"** by Chen, Yubo, et al
Proposes a CNN-based approach for event extraction
**"A Survey on Event Extraction from Text"** by Liu, Zhiyuan, et al
Provides a survey of event extraction techniques and challenges
**"Event Detection and Co-reference with Minimal Supervision"** by Chen, Yubo, et al
Discusses methods for event detection with minimal supervision
These articles should provide a solid foundation for understanding the various aspects of event-centric NLP, including foundational concepts, methodologies, and recent advancements
